January 21, 1979: Fiction
CHESAPEAKE, by James A. Michener. (Random House, $12.95.) Four centuries
of Maryland's Eastern Shore.
WAR AND REMEMBRANCE, by Herman Wouk. (Little, Brown, $15.) The Henry
family of "The Winds of War" during World War II.
FOOLS DIE, by Mario Puzo. (Putnam's, $12.50.) Hollywood tycoons and literary
celebrities gamble with fate.
SECOND GENERATION, by Howard Fast. (Houghton Mifflin, $10.95.) The
children of "The immigrants" on the eve of World War II.
THE SILMARILLION, by J.R.R. Tolkien. (Houghton Mifflin, $10.95.) Middle Earth
in pre-Hobbit days.
THE FAR PAVILIONS, by M.M. Kaye. (St. Martin's, $12.95.) Love and war in the
high Himalayas.
EVERGREEN, by Belva Plain. (Delacorte, $10.) Jewish immigrant woman's rise
from Lower East Side poverty.
THE STORIES OF JOHN CHEEVER, by John Cheever. (Knopf, $15.) Visions of
lost moral order amid contemporary domestic disarray.
BRIGHT FLOWS THE RIVER, by Taylor Caldwell. (Doubleday, $10.95.) The
angsts of a man confined to a sanitarium.
ILLUSIONS, by Richard Bach. (Delacorte/Eleanor Friede, $6.95.) Messiah
barnstorms Middle America.
THE COUP, by John Updike. (Knopf, $8.95.) A comedy of incongruities set in
modern Africa.
WIFEY, by Judy Blume. (Putnam's, $8.95.) A woman's search for emotional
identity.
PRELUDE TO TERROR, by Helen MacInnes (Harcourt Brace Jovanovich, $10.)
An art consultant amid an international conspiracy.
EYE OF THE NEEDLE, by Ken Follett. (Arbor House, $8.95.) Nazi spy vs. British
professor in a World War II thriller.
THE STAND, by Stephen King. (Doubleday, $12.95.) Terrible disease sweeps
across the United States.
January 21, 1979
Non-Fiction
MOMMIE DEAREST, by Christina Crawford. (Morrow, $9.95.) Life with Joan
Crawford.
A DISTANT MIRROR, by Barbara W. Tuchman. (Knopf, $15.95.) The calamitous
14th century.
IF LIFE IS A BOWL OF CHERRIES -- WHAT AM I DOING IN THE PITS?  by
Erma Bombeck. (McGraw-Hill, $7.95.) More domestic drolleries.
GNOMES, text by Wil Huygen, illustrated by Rien Poortvliet. (Harry N. Abrams,
$17.50.) All about the little people.
AMERICAN CAESAR, by William Manchester. (Little, Brown, $15.) The life of
Douglas MacArthur.
FAERIES, described and illustrated by Brian Froud and Alan Lee. (Harry N.
Abrams, $14.95.) Life in a world of magic.
IN SEARCH OF HISTORY, by Theodore H. White. (Harper & Row, $12.95.) A
journalist's memoirs.
THE COMPLETE BOOK OF RUNNING, by James F. Fixx. (Random House, $10.)
For fun and health.
TUTANKHAMUN: The Untold Story, by Thomas Hoving. (Simon & Schuster,
$12.95.) Howard Carter's relations with the Metropolitan Museum.
JACKIE OH! by Kitty Kelley. (Holt, $14.95.) A gossipy biography of Jacqueline
Kennedy Onassis.
THE BUCHWALD STOPS HERE, by Art Buchwald. (Putnam's, $9.95.) More
collected columns by the satirical pundit.
NURSE, by Peggy Anderson. (St. Martin's Press, $10.95.) The personal and
professional life of a nurse in a metropolitan hospital.
ROBERT KENNEDY AND HIS TIMES, by Arthur M. Schlesinger, Jr. (Houghton
Mifflin, $19.95.) The politician and the forces that shaped him.
WANDERINGS, by Chaim Potok. (Knopf, $17.95.) Four thousand years of Jewish
history.
THE ANN LANDERS ENCYCLOPEDIA A TO Z, by Ann Landers. (Doubleday,
$17.50.) Advice on everyday problems by the syndicated columnist.
